description.narrative: Nicaragua - Transportation Project: The Transportation Project was aimed at connecting regional markets and reducing transportation time and costs through improving one primary road (Villanueva-Guasaule) and two secondary roads (Leon-Poneloya and Somotillo-Cinco Pinos), for a total of 74 km.

title.narrative: Measuring Results of the Nicaragua Transportation Project

condition.narrative: A Construction Supervisor remains engaged, pursuant to an agreement that the Board and MCC have duly approved and that is in full force and effect.

A Cooperation Agreement between MCA-N and MTI laying out the respective roles and responsibilities of the parties as they relate to the Transportation Project (e.g., grant of access to rehabilitate, agreement to accept, etc.) has been duly approved by MCC and is in full force and effect.

A Transportation Project Manager remains engaged pursuant to an agreement that the Board and MCC have duly approved and that is in full force and effect, or in the event the position is vacant, MCA-N is actively recruiting for the position to the satisfaction of MCC.

An Infrastructure Specialist for MCA-N is selected and approved by MCC and remains engaged, or in the event the position is vacant, MCA-N is actively recruiting for the position to the satisfaction of MCC.

Environment and Social Impact Specialist for MCA-N is selected and approved by MCC and remains engaged, or in the event the position is vacant, MCA-N is actively recruiting for the position to the satisfaction of MCC.
MCA-N provides evidence of GoN enactment of legislation on national road safety, satisfactory to MCC, and the GoN implements and enforces such legislation.
MCA-N provides evidence that the FOMAV budget for routine and periodic maintenance for the maintainable road network has been approved for the forthcoming fiscal year at levels acceptable to MCC.
MCA-N provides evidence that the amounts budgeted by FOMAV for routine and periodic maintenance in the prior fiscal year have been expended in a manner satisfactory to MCC.
MCA-N provides evidence, satisfactory to MCC, that the FOMAV legislation to ensure sustainable maintenance of the national road network remains in full force and effect.
MCA-N submits to MCC, and MCC approves, a completed needs assessment of TA requirements of MTI and FOMAV to fully define the project activity.

title.narrative: Annual average daily traffic volume: Villanueva ? Guasaule

description.narrative: Level Objective of Indicator for Transportation Project
